alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Dinwiddie; Gloucester; James City; Prince George; Surry; Sussex; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 3:58PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Gloucester, Charles City, Prince George, northwestern York, northeastern Sussex, east central Dinwiddie, James City and central Surry Counties, the City of Hopewell and the City of Petersburg through 500 PM EDT... At 357 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from near Holdcroft to near Prince George to near Carson. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Rainfall 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rainfall may cause minor flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Holdcroft around 400 PM EDT. Toano around 410 PM EDT. Norge and Jordans Point around 415 PM EDT. Williamsburg and Garysville around 420 PM EDT. Burrowsville around 430 PM EDT. Waverly around 435 PM EDT. Cabin Point around 440 PM EDT. Claremont around 450 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Taylors Corner, Carsley, Chickahominy Shore, Croaker, Birchett Estate, Spring Grove, Jordan Point Country Club, Petersburg National Battlefield, Ewell and Richard Bland College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Dinwiddie; Gloucester; James City; Prince George; Surry; Sussex; York
